title: Police investigate fire at home of officer charged with Walter Scott killing
description: Police are looking into a fire at the home of the former South Carolina police officer accused in the shooting death of a black man last April. Related: Michael Slager fired from South Carolina police force after killing of Walter Scott Local media outlets report the fire at the vacant home of Michael Slager was reported around 9.20pm on Friday in Hanahan.Slager is the former North Charleston police officer charged with murder in connection with the shooting death of Walter Scott.Maj Eric Watson of Charleston County sheriff’s department confirmed that a glass cocktail bottle was found at the scene. A portion of the home’s vinyl siding was damaged in the fire.Capt Michael Fowler of Hanahan police said an arson investigation is under way.Slager, who is white, was released on bond on Monday. Activists want him back in jail because they say he is a danger to the community.
